standards.title: System and software quality models

clauses.title: Time behavior
clauses.summary: System meets response time and processing time targets under stated conditions.

clauses.title: Resource utilization
clauses.summary: System uses CPU, memory, storage, and network within specified bounds.

clauses.title: Capacity
clauses.summary: System sustains a defined number of users/transactions/data volume.

clauses.title: Confidentiality
clauses.summary: Data is accessible only to authorized parties.

clauses.title: Integrity
clauses.summary: Information is protected from unauthorized modification.

clauses.title: Authenticity
clauses.summary: Identity of users and components can be reliably verified.

clauses.title: Accountability
clauses.summary: Actions can be traced to a uniquely identifiable actor.

clauses.title: Availability
clauses.summary: System is operational and accessible when required.

standards.title: Requirements engineering

clauses.title: Elicitation
clauses.summary: Plan and conduct elicitation using appropriate techniques; record sources and outcomes.

clauses.title: Analysis
clauses.summary: Analyze, classify, and decompose stakeholder needs into candidate requirements.

clauses.title: Specification
clauses.summary: Specify requirements clearly and consistently in a managed information item (e.g., SRS).

clauses.title: Validation
clauses.summary: Confirm the specified requirements satisfy stakeholder needs and intended use.

clauses.title: Verification
clauses.summary: Establish verification methods and acceptance criteria for each requirement.

clauses.title: Requirements management
clauses.summary: Baseline, version, and control changes; maintain status, ownership, and history.

clauses.title: Prioritization
clauses.summary: Prioritize requirements (e.g., MoSCoW, value/risk) and record rationale.

clauses.title: Traceability
clauses.summary: Maintain bidirectional trace links to sources, design, code, tests, and risks.

clauses.title: Requirement attributes
clauses.summary: Capture attributes such as ID, source, rationale, priority, risk, and verification method.

clauses.title: Necessary
clauses.summary: Each requirement is needed to meet a stakeholder need or constraint.

clauses.title: Correct
clauses.summary: Accurately represents a true need with no factual errors.

clauses.title: Unambiguous
clauses.summary: Statement permits only one interpretation by all stakeholders.

clauses.title: Complete
clauses.summary: Contains all necessary information to implement and verify; no TBDs.

clauses.title: Singular (atomic)
clauses.summary: Specifies one thing only; avoids conjunctions that bundle multiple requirements.

clauses.title: Feasible
clauses.summary: Realizable within known constraints (technology, cost, schedule).

clauses.title: Verifiable
clauses.summary: Objective verification method can be defined and executed.

clauses.title: Prioritized
clauses.summary: Priority or rank is stated to guide planning and trade-offs.

clauses.title: Consistent
clauses.summary: No internal conflicts and consistent terminology across the SRS.

clauses.title: Modifiable
clauses.summary: SRS organization and notation allow easy updates with controlled impact.

clauses.title: Traceable
clauses.summary: Each requirement uniquely identified and linked to its sources and realizations.

clauses.summary: Outline SRS organization and how to navigate the document.

clauses.title: User characteristics

clauses.title: Assumptions and dependencies

clauses.title: Functional requirements

clauses.title: Interface requirements

clauses.title: Design and implementation constraints
clauses.summary: Mandated technologies, standards, and operational constraints.

clauses.title: Natural language guidance

clauses.title: Use cases and scenarios
clauses.summary: Capture actor goals, main flows, and alternative paths.

clauses.title: Performance
clauses.summary: Response time, throughput, and capacity targets with conditions.

clauses.title: Reliability
clauses.summary: Failure rates, MTBF/MTTR, and recovery requirements.

clauses.title: Availability
clauses.summary: Uptime objectives, redundancy, and maintenance windows.

clauses.title: Security
clauses.summary: AuthN/AuthZ, confidentiality, integrity, audit, and privacy.

clauses.title: Safety
clauses.summary: Hazard identification, risk reduction, safe states.

clauses.title: Usability
clauses.summary: Learnability, efficiency, error tolerance, and accessibility.

clauses.summary: Modularity, diagnostics, configuration, and logging.

clauses.title: Portability
clauses.summary: Supported platforms, data migration, and install/uninstall.

clauses.title: Compatibility
clauses.summary: Coexistence and interoperability with other systems.

clauses.title: Acceptance criteria
clauses.summary: Define measurable pass/fail criteria per requirement.

clauses.title: Change control

clauses.title: Risk considerations
